sen.j: 磯野 小右衛門（いそのこえもん、文政8年10月3日 (旧暦)（1825年11月12日） - 明治36年（1903年）6月11日）は、幕末から明治にかけて大阪を中心に活躍した実業家。
sen.e: Koemon ISONO (1825-1903): A businessman who played a lively part centering around Osaka from the end of Edo Period to Meiji Period.
Koemon ISONO (November 12, 1825 - June 11, 1903) was an entrepreneur, primarily based in Osaka from the end of Edo Period to Meiji Period.
Koemon ISONO (November 12, 1825 - June 11, 1903) was an entrepreneur, primarily based in Osaka from the end of Edo Period to Meiji Period.
Born in Abu County, Nagato Province.
He was born in Abu County, Nagato Province.
sen.cmt: 文章形式に修正しました。
sen.e: He was born in Abu County, Nagato Province.

sen.j: 嘉永4年（1851年）大坂堂島にて米穀商を開店。
sen.e: He opened a rice dealing business in Dojima, Osaka in 1851.
He opened a rice distribution business in Dojima, Osaka in 1851.
He opened a rice distribution business in Dojima, Osaka in 1851.

sen.j: 明治維新後堂島米市場の再興に尽力し、明治4年（1871年）堂島米会所（後の堂島米商会所）を再興して初代頭取となった。
sen.e: He contributed to the restoration of Dojima rice exchange market and became the first chief of Dojim a rice exchange (later, meeting place for Dojima rice exchange) in 1871.
He contributed to the restoration of Dojima rice exchange market and became the first chief of Dojima rice association (later, Dojima rice trading company) in 1871.
sen.cmt: Dojim→Dojima堂島米会所をDojima rice association、堂島米商会所をDojima rice trading companyに修正しました。
sen.e: He contributed to the restoration of Dojima rice exchange market and became the first chief of Dojima rice association (later, Dojima rice trading company) in 1871.

sen.j: また、明治11年（1878年）の大阪商法会議所（のち大阪商業会議所を経て現大阪商工会議所の前身）設立にあったては発起人に名を連ね、明治24年（1891年）7月より明治27年（1894年）3月にかけて大阪商業会議所4代目会頭をつとめた。
sen.e: Also at the establishment of Osaka Chamber of Commercial Law (later, Osaka Chamber of Business, the predecessor of the present Osaka Chamber of Commerce and Industry), he added his name as a member to the list of promoters, and served as the 4th chief of Osaka Chamber of Business from 1891 to 1894.

Also at the establishment of Osaka Chamber of Commercial Law (later, Osaka Chamber of Business, the predecessor of the present Osaka Chamber of Commerce and Industry), he became one of its promoters, and served as the 4th chief of Osaka Chamber of Business from 1891 to 1894.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に変えました。
sen.e: Also at the establishment of Osaka Chamber of Commercial Law (later, Osaka Chamber of Business, the predecessor of the present Osaka Chamber of Commerce and Industry), he became one of its promoters, and served as the 4th chief of Osaka Chamber of Business from 1891 to 1894.

sen.j: この間米相場で成功を収め、また後に北浜銀行などの設立にも関わった。
sen.e: During this period he succeeded in rice price dealing, and he was took part in the establishment of Kitahama bank.
During this period, he profited in the rice price market, and also took part in the establishment of Kitahama bank.
sen.cmt: 文法を直しました。succeededをprofitedに変えました。
sen.e: During this period, he profited in the rice price market, and also took part in the establishment of Kitahama bank.

sen.j: 井上馨の娘であった聞(ぶん)を養女にしたが、聞は後に井上姓に戻った。
sen.e: He adopted Bun, the daughter of Kaoru INOUE as his stepdaughter, but afterwards she returned to the original family name, INOUE.
He adopted Bun, the daughter of Kaoru INOUE, but she later changed to her original family name, INOUE.
sen.cmt: stepdaughterは「養女」ではなく「義理の娘」ですので"she"に置き換えました。
sen.e: He adopted Bun, the daughter of Kaoru INOUE, but she later changed to her original family name, INOUE.

sen.j: 司馬遼太郎の小説「俄」にも登場している。
sen.e: He also appeared in the novel "Niwaka" by Ryotaro SHIBA.
He also appeared in the novel "Niwaka" by Ryotaro SHIBA.
